New Records: Devon Conway has scored 307 runs in four ODI innings in India, averaging 102.3 with a strike rate of 121 and two centuries to his name; Matt Henry has picked up the most wickets for New Zealand in ODIs since the start of 2022, taking 35 wickets in 21 innings at 26.20; New Zealand won the match by 99 runs, their sixth match in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24
Key Match Events: New Zealand won the match by 99 runs; Devon Conway scored 307 runs in four ODI innings in India; Matt Henry took the most wickets for New Zealand in ODIs since the start of 2022
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands have a strong record against New Zealand, winning four of their five previous ODIs; New Zealand's Kane Williamson is expected to return in their third match against Bangladesh; New Zealand has never lost a World Cup game against an Associate nation in their history; Netherlands have shown spunk in their first game and know the conditions in Hyderabad better than New Zealand
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand won the match by 99 runs; the result marked New Zealand's continued dominance in the World Cup; Netherlands showed resilience but ultimately couldn't overcome New Zealand's strong performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hyderabad surface has historically been a high-scoring one with an average first-innings score of 288; the pitch had a light biscuit brown tinge to it on the eve of the game; the temperature was expected to be in the mid-30s; Devon Conway has a stellar record in India; Matt Henry has picked up the most wickets for New Zealand in ODIs since the start of 2022
